Detailed Description

Writes typed data to FileOutputStream.

Typically, this stream can be read in by DataInputStream. Types that can be written include byte, 16-bit short, 32-bit int, 32-bit float, 64-bit long, 64-bit double, byte strings, and MUTF-8 encoded strings.

The following example demonstrates how to use this DataOutputStream class.

 MyPage::onInit(Persistence* const savedInstanceState) {

     // new Content instance
     gaia::core::Context* context = new gaia::core::Context(this);

     // From the DataInputStream.
     gaia::base::String fileName("file.txt");
     gaia::storage::FileInputStream* fis = context->openFileInput(fileName);
     gaia::storage::DataInputStream* dis = new gaia::storage::DataInputStream(*fis);
     int visits = dis->readInt();
     int64_t date = dis->readLong();
     gaia::base::String title = dis->readUTF();
     gaia::base::String webaddress = dis->readUTF().trim();

     // Write a file from /data/data/PackageName/files/file.txt.
     gaia::storage::FileOutputStream* fos = context->openFileOutput(fileNamee, Context::MODE_PRIVATE);
     // Wrap a FileOutputStream for writing big-endian typed data into it.
     gaia::storage::DataOutputStream* dos = new gaia::storage::DataOutputStream(*fos);

     dos->writeInt(visits);
     dos->writeLong(date);
     dos->writeUTF(title);
     dos->writeUTF(webaddress->trim());

     dos->close();
     fos->close();
 }

See the sample given above. It writes a file into /data/data/PackageName/files/file.txt. And for writing big-endian typed data into it, it wraps a FileOutputStream into DataOutputStream. MODE_PRIVATE will create the file (or replace a file of the same name) and make it private to your application. Other modes available are: MODE_APPEND, MODE_WORLD_READABLE, and MODE_WORLD_WRITEABLE.

See also:
DataInputStream

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

gaia::storage::DataOutputStream::DataOutputStream ( const OutputStream &  out) [explicit]

Constructs a new DataOutputStream on the OutputStream out.

Note that data written by this stream is not in a human readable form but can be reconstructed by using a DataInputStream on the resulting output.

Parameters:
outthe target stream for writing.
virtual gaia::storage::DataOutputStream::~DataOutputStream ( ) [virtual]

Member Function Documentation

void gaia::storage::DataOutputStream::close ( ) [virtual]

Closes this stream.

This implementation closes the underlying operating system resources allocated to represent this stream.

Reimplemented from gaia::storage::OutputStream.

void gaia::storage::DataOutputStream::flush ( ) [virtual]

Flushes this stream to ensure all pending data is sent out to the target stream.

This implementation then also flushes the target stream.

Reimplemented from gaia::storage::OutputStream.

void gaia::storage::DataOutputStream::writeInt ( int32_t  val)

Writes a 32-bit int32_t to the target stream.

The resulting output is the four bytes, highest order first, of val.

Parameters:
valthe int32_t to write to the target stream.
See also:
DataInputStream::readInt()
void gaia::storage::DataOutputStream::writeLong ( int64_t  val)

Writes a 64-bit long to the target stream.

The resulting output is the eight bytes, highest order first, of val.

Parameters:
valthe long to write to the target stream.
See also:
DataInputStream::readLong()
void gaia::storage::DataOutputStream::writeShort ( int32_t  val)

Writes the specified 16-bit short to the target stream.

Only the lower two bytes of the integer val are written, with the higher one written first.

Parameters:
valthe short to write to the target stream.
See also:
